lps.pr2
Class Inventory

java.lang.Object
  lps.pr2.Inventory

public class Inventory
extends java.lang.Object

An inventory stores the items the player picks during the game. The inventory can be examined, presenting the names of the objects contained in it. Additionally, we can examine a single object in the inventory.

Field Summary
protected  java.util.Hashtable<java.lang.String,Item> _items
          The collection that stores the items collected by the player

_items

protected java.util.Hashtable<java.lang.String,Item> _items
The collection that stores the items collected by the player

Constructor Detail

Inventory

public Inventory()
Creates a new, empty inventory

Method Detail

addItem

public boolean addItem(Item newItem)
Adds a new item to the inventory, if there is no item with the same name

Parameters:
newItem - The item that can be stored in the inventory
Returns:
  • true, if the item was correctly stored in the inventory
  • false, if there is another item with the same name in the inventory. In this case, the newItem is not stored in the inventory.

    • examineItem

    public java.lang.String examineItem(java.lang.String name)
    Provides information about an item contained in the inventory, identified by its name

    Parameters:
    name - Name of the item to be examined
    Returns:
    The item description, or a warning message, if the item was not found in the inventory

    removeItem

    public Item removeItem(java.lang.String name)
    Removes the item identified by the name from the inventory and returns the removed item

    Parameters:
    name - Name of the item to be removed
    Returns:
    The removed item, or null, if there is not any item with this name in the inventory

    showInventory

    public java.lang.String showInventory()
    Provides information about which items the inventory stores

    Returns:
    A string with information about the items contained in the inventory

    computePoints

    public int computePoints()
    Computes the total number of points provided by the items stored in the inventory

    Returns:
    The total number of points as the sum up of the item values
